text: Banham Group (formerly known as Banham Patent Locks) is a family owned security company.https://www.telegraph.co.uk/business/private-equity- investment/security-business-banham/ Established in 1926, Banham Group is now the largest supplier of burglary and fire prevention systems in London.Lea, Robert (2010). "Going for Growth: why Banham is not going to bolt now" The Timeshttp://www.banham.co.uk/about-banham/about/ The company's history dates back to 1926, when William F. Banham invented the first automatic latch bolt lock after a series of burglaries on his wife's dress shop. He opened his own locksmith shop on Oxford Street, London, and offered £25 to anyone who could pick or break one of his patented locks.Lea, Robert (2010). "Going for Growth: why Banham is not going to bolt now" The TimesEvening Standard. 9/25/2014, p73. 1p. Banham Group still offer the patented locks and security key registration system as well as other security products and services. Between the years 1968 and 1981, the company created an alarms division, an access control division and opened an Alarm Receiving Centre. Since then, they have received awards from the Metropolitan Police for their alarm systems, and certificates from Secured by Design, the official UK Police flagship initiative, for their locks, shutters, grilles and safes. The company also provides security for celebrities and politicians.Evening Standard. 9/25/2014, p73. 1p. The company has a head office based in Earlsfield, and showrooms in Kensington, Golders Green, Thames Valley Maidenhead, Guildford and the South Coast Showroom in Worthning.https://www.banham.co.uk/showrooms/ Banham Group moved to its purpose-built headquarters in Earlsfield from their offices in Vauxhall in 2015.http://www.wandsworth.gov.uk/news/article/12072/new_development_set_to_boost_earlsfield_economy ==Companies in the Banham Group== *Aegis Alarm Systems *Banham Patent Locks Ltd *Banham Close Protection *Bridger Alarms *Capstan Security *Close Link Security *CMS Keyholding *GSM Security Ltd *Security 201 *Tara Burglar Alarms ==References== ==Sources== * The Glasgow Herald (13 January 1931) p. 8 == External links == * Category:Locksmiths Category:Lock manufacturers Category:Manufacturing companies established in 1926 Category:Fire detection and alarm companies Category:Security companies of the United Kingdom Category:Technology companies established in 1926 Category:1926 establishments in England
